abstract.t: This document describes procedures to support node protection for Point-to-Multipoint and Multipoint-to-Multipoint Label Switched Paths (MP LSPs) that have been built by the "Multipoint Label Distribution Protocol"(mLDP) [RFC6388]. In order to protect a node N, the Point of Local Repair (PLR) Label Switched Router (LSR) of N must learn the Merge Point (MPT) LSR(s) of node N such that traffic can be redirected to them in case node N fails. Redirecting the traffic around the failed node N depends on existing P2P LSPs. The pre- established LSPs originate from the PLR LSR and terminate on the MPT LSRs while bypassing LSR N.
